Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.time

Class ParseInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.naturalis.common.time.ParseInfo
  • public final class ParseInfo
extends Object
    A ParseInfo specifies how to parse a date string. The following can be specified when parsing a date string:

    1. Either a date/time pattern or a DateTimeFormatter instance. Required.
    2. One or more TemporalQuery objects that effectively specify into which type of date/time object you want the date string to be parsed. For example: LocalDate::from. Optional. Ordinarily you would specify them in descending order of granularity, but that is not required. Unless you are dealing with an exotic date/time pattern it is recommended that you provide at least one TemporalQuery object.
    3. A UnaryOperator that transforms the date string before it is passed on to the DateTimeFormatter. Optional. If the operator returns null, the date string will be treated as unparsable.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static ParseInfo ISO_INSTANT
      A ready-made ParseInfo instance that parses date strings using the ISO_INSTANT formatter into an Instant object.
      static ParseInfo ISO_LOCAL_DATE
      A ready-made ParseInfo instance that parses date strings using the ISO_LOCAL_DATE formatter into a LocalDate object.
      static ParseInfo ISO_LOCAL_DATE_TIME
      A ready-made ParseInfo instance that parses date strings using the ISO_LOCAL_DATE_TIME formatter into a LocalDateTime object.
      static ParseInfo ISO_OFFSET_DATE_TIME
      A ready-made ParseInfo instance that parses date strings using the ISO_OFFSET_DATE_TIME formatter into an OffsetDateTime object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      UnaryOperator<String> getFilter()
      Returns the filter used to transform the input string, or null if no filter is used by this ParseInfo.
      DateTimeFormatter getFormatter()
      Returns the DateTimeFormatter used to parse the date string.
      List<TemporalQuery<TemporalAccessor>> getParseInto()
      Returns the type of date/time object(s) the date string is allowed to be parsed into.
      String getPattern()
      Returns the date/time pattern used to parse the date string or null if the ParseInfo was instantiated with a ready-made DateTimeFormatter object.

                 List<TemporalQuery<TemporalAccessor>> parseInto)

        Parameters:
        pattern - The date/time pattern according to which to parse the date strings
        parseInto - The TemporalQuery object(s) that specify the type of the date/time object (e.g. LocalDate::from). Must not be null, but may be empty.

      • ParseInfo

        public ParseInfo​(String pattern,
                 List<TemporalQuery<TemporalAccessor>> parseInto,
                 UnaryOperator<String> filter)
        Creates a new ParseInfo instance.
        Parameters:
        pattern - The date/time pattern according to which to parse the date strings
        parseInto - The TemporalQuery object(s) that specify the type of the date/time object (e.g. LocalDate::from). Must not be null, but may be empty.
        filter - An optional filter to be applied to the date string before it is parsed. May be null.

      • ParseInfo

        public ParseInfo​(DateTimeFormatter formatter,

        parseInto - The TemporalQuery object(s) that specify the type of the date/time object (e.g. LocalDate::from). Must not be null, but may be empty.
        filter - An optional filter to be applied to the date string before it is parsed. May be null.

    • Method Detail

      • getFilter

        public UnaryOperator<String> getFilter()
        Returns the filter used to transform the input string, or null if no filter is used by this ParseInfo. The filter's apply method is allowed to return null, in which case the input string will be treated as not parsable by the FuzzyDateParser.
        Returns:

      • getFormatter

        public DateTimeFormatter getFormatter()
        Returns the DateTimeFormatter used to parse the date string.
        Returns:

      • getParseInto

        public List<TemporalQuery<TemporalAccessor>> getParseInto()
        Returns the type of date/time object(s) the date string is allowed to be parsed into.
        Returns:

      • getPattern

        public String getPattern()
        Returns the date/time pattern used to parse the date string or null if the ParseInfo was instantiated with a ready-made DateTimeFormatter object.
        Returns:
